definition: genius comes from hard effort/Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration (Thomas Edison)
pinyin: tian1 cai2 chu1 zi4 qin2 fen4

sentences.english: The principal must be hard-working, good at learning and enterprising.
sentences.chinese: 校長必須是一個勤奮學習，善於學習，勇於進取的人。

sentences.english: By a titanic effort out footbisexualngl teare won the victory.
sentences.chinese: 我們的球隊付出很大的勤奮，取得了勝利。

sentences.english: Because he believed success came from industry, he was very industrious.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他相信成功來自勤奮，他是非常勤奮的。

sentences.english: Because he believed success came from industry, he was very industrious.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他相信成功來自勤奮，他是非常勤奮的。

sentences.english: Since childhood love of art, hard-working people, self-taught.
sentences.chinese: 自幼熱愛美術，勤奮過人，自學成材。

sentences.english: As often as I praised him for his hard work, he kept silent.
sentences.chinese: 每當我表揚他工作勤奮時，他總是默不做聲。

sentences.english: And he is the hardest working guy, and in a certain way I did this -- where is Reince?
sentences.chinese: 他是個勤奮工作的人，某些時候我也是。

sentences.english: This progress is the product of hard work and ingenuity multiplied across billions of individual lives.
sentences.chinese: 這種進步是數十億人勤奮努力和創新的結晶。

sentences.english: Diligence and discipline can reduce the incidence of these errors to near zero.
sentences.chinese: 勤奮和自律可以讓這些錯誤造成的影響降至最低限度。

sentences.english: This behaviour is not conducive to hard work.
sentences.chinese: 這種舉止行爲不可能認真勤奮地工作。

sentences.english: The teacher feels all the happier for hellos diligence.
sentences.chinese: 老師因他的勤奮而感到格外開心。

sentences.english: Through hard work, he won popularity among the students.
sentences.chinese: 由於工作勤奮，他在學生中很受歡迎。

sentences.english: In his mind, hard work was a ladder to success.
sentences.chinese: 在他的思想裏，勤奮工作是通往成功的梯子。

sentences.english: OK. But you he to promise me that you will study hard in your English class.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，那麼你得答應我你會更勤奮地把英文學得更好。

sentences.english: I put it all down to his hard work and initiative.
sentences.chinese: 我把這一切歸因於他工作既勤奮又主動。

sentences.english: Studious , willing to start from the grass-roots level.
sentences.chinese: 勤奮好學，願從基層做起。

definition: to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy/steady and serious character
firmly-based/steady/steadfast/to have peace of mind/free from anxiety/Taiwan pr. [ta4 shi2]
to offer respectfully/to consecrate/to dedicate/to devote
